pain_points.description: Manual data extraction and input from various sources into financial models.
pain_points.evidence: Rodolfo states, 'All this is manual input' (00:09:52) when referring to his Excel proforma. He later reiterates, 'And you do this manually, you download this building, you look, and then you put this data. Exactly, and all of this manually.' (00:16:04-00:16:06). Visual evidence at 09:37-14:02 (Excel) and 14:02-16:27 (PDF) shows him scrolling through documents and spreadsheets, implying manual transfer.

pain_points.description: Time-consuming preliminary analysis ('back of the envelope') and full proforma development.
pain_points.evidence: Rodolfo mentions, 'This thing takes easily a week' for a well-done proforma (00:18:39). For a quick 'back of the envelope' analysis, he states, 'I don't want to spend more than... 3, 4 hours doing this thing' (00:26:31-00:26:35). He further clarifies, 'to get to a Proforma of that level I showed you... that thing takes 1, 2 weeks.' (00:26:55-00:27:00).

pain_points.description: Fragmented workflow requiring switching between multiple applications and tools.
pain_points.evidence: Visual evidence shows Rodolfo switching between Microsoft Excel (09:37), Adobe Acrobat (14:02), and ChatGPT (19:21). Pedro observes this, stating, 'I think it's funny that you showed me that you accessed the GPT chat and then you took this information and put it on the other side.' (00:44:43-00:44:46). He further describes the pain as 'Making this bridge of not leaving a screen, putting it in the GPT chat, copying and returning.' (00:45:15-00:45:21).

pain_points.description: Difficulty and cost of accessing comprehensive market data.
pain_points.evidence: Rodolfo mentions CoStar as a 'giant company that captures a lot of data' (00:07:34) but also states, 'Because it's expensive. Not everyone has access to the cold store. The cold store is worth $2,000 a month, something like that.' (00:32:31-00:32:37).

pain_points.description: The need for extensive industry knowledge and experience to accurately underwrite projects.
pain_points.evidence: Rodolfo explains, 'Today, you're still an art, you still need a lot of time in the industry, you need to have knowledge of the area, you need to know what you're doing to underwrite a project.' (00:40:15-00:40:25). He uses ChatGPT to get benchmarks for property types he is less familiar with (office buildings vs. multifamily).

pain_points.description: Complex and varied zoning codes make land use analysis difficult.
pain_points.evidence: Rodolfo describes, 'Each city has a different zoning code... There are 60 different types of zones. And each of these different zones has different restrictions.' (00:41:53-00:42:32). He notes, 'And that's why you have a lot of zoning attorneys.' (00:42:55).

current_workflows.name: Preliminary Deal Evaluation ('Back of the Envelope')
current_workflows.description: Rodolfo receives an Offering Memorandum (OM) from a broker (e.g., Cushman & Wakefield). He reviews the OM (PDF) for initial project details and market data. For property types he's less familiar with (e.g., office buildings vs. multifamily), he uses ChatGPT to quickly gather benchmark data like rent per square foot, vacancy rates, operating expense ratios, and cap rates for the specific location (e.g., Coral Gables). He then manually inputs this data, along with information from the OM, into a simplified Excel spreadsheet model ('Back of the Envelope'). This process takes 3-4 hours and helps him quickly determine if a project is worth pursuing further.
current_workflows.timestamp: 14:02-16:27 (OM review), 19:21-21:33 (ChatGPT usage), 26:16-28:49 (Excel 'Back of the Envelope' analysis), 00:26:29-00:26:37 (time estimate)

current_workflows.name: Detailed Financial Modeling (Full Proforma)
current_workflows.description: If a project passes the 'back of the envelope' stage, Rodolfo or his team proceeds to a full proforma analysis. This involves extensive data gathering from sources like CoStar for comparable property sales, rents, and market trends. He manually inputs these detailed figures into a complex, structured Excel spreadsheet model. This model includes sections for investment summary, sources and uses, proforma key assumptions, stabilized proforma summary, property-level returns, development returns, exit summary, and financing summary. This process is highly iterative, requiring adjustments to inputs based on market validation and desired outcomes. This detailed analysis can take 1-2 weeks.
tools: CoStar (accessed directly or indirectly via OM)
screens_involved: Excel spreadsheet (multiple tabs like SUMMARY, INPUTS, RENT ANALYSIS, BUDGET, MONTHLY SCHEDULE, ANNUAL PROFORMA)
current_workflows.timestamp: 09:37-14:02 (Excel proforma demonstration), 00:07:24-00:08:22 (CoStar description), 00:10:24-00:10:44 (manual inputs in Excel), 00:18:36-00:18:39 (time estimate)

current_workflows.name: Market Data Validation
current_workflows.description: Rodolfo validates assumptions in his models by comparing them against market data. This involves reviewing 'Land Sale Comparables' and 'Office Submarket Breakdown' tables in Offering Memorandums (PDF) and cross-referencing with quick lookups on ChatGPT for specific metrics (e.g., cap rates, operating expenses for a new property type). He manually compares these figures to his own project assumptions, often making 'artistic' judgments based on multiple data points.
current_workflows.timestamp: 14:02-16:27 (OM comparables), 00:17:37-00:17:47 (validating with market info), 19:21-21:33 (ChatGPT for validation), 00:24:48-00:25:53 (comparing OM and ChatGPT data)

data_sources.name: CoStar
data_sources.data_provided: Extensive data on properties, including sale prices, rental rates per unit, average development prices, market comparables (comps), land sale comparables, office submarket breakdowns (rent, occupancy).
data_sources.access_method: Subscription-based system, often accessed by brokers or larger firms. Rodolfo uses it directly or indirectly via OMs.
data_sources.limitations: Expensive ($2,000/month mentioned), not everyone has access. Data needs to be manually extracted and input into models.

data_sources.name: Cushman & Wakefield Offering Memorandum (OM)
data_sources.data_provided: Detailed market analysis for specific properties, including land sale comparables, office submarket breakdowns (Class A/B, area, average rent, occupancy), property descriptions, floor plans, and initial proforma assumptions.
data_sources.access_method: Received from brokers (e.g., Cushman & Wakefield) as a PDF document.
data_sources.limitations: Data needs to be manually read and extracted. May contain data from CoStar but requires manual interpretation and transfer. Not always available for all properties.

data_sources.name: ChatGPT
data_sources.data_provided: Quick benchmark data for specific property types and locations (e.g., Coral Gables office building: rent per sq/ft, vacancy rate, operating expense ratio, cap rate). Provides structured underwriting advice.
data_sources.access_method: Web-based chat interface, user inputs prompts.
data_sources.limitations: Requires manual prompting and manual transfer of information into financial models. Data accuracy depends on the AI's training data and prompt quality. Rodolfo uses 'ChatGPT 5.2'.

data_sources.name: Public Records
data_sources.data_provided: Sales prices of properties, ownership information, and other publicly disclosed real estate transactions.
data_sources.access_method: Accessed by data aggregators like CoStar, or directly by users (implied).
data_sources.limitations: Requires effort to find and compile. Often aggregated by other services.

data_sources.name: realtor.com
data_sources.data_provided: Property listings, land availability, and characteristics for active project searching.
data_sources.limitations: Provides raw listings, requires further analysis to extract relevant data for financial modeling.

user_personas.name: Rodolfo Guerra (Real Estate Developer/Analyst)
user_personas.role: Real estate developer, responsible for evaluating potential projects, performing financial modeling, and making investment decisions.
user_personas.goals: Efficiently identify viable real estate development opportunities, accurately assess financial returns, and minimize time spent on preliminary analysis to focus on strategic decisions.
user_personas.frustrations: Manual and time-consuming data entry, fragmented workflow across multiple applications, the 'art' required to interpret market data, and the high cost/limited access to comprehensive data sources like CoStar.
user_personas.tech_sophistication: Proficient with Excel for complex financial models, uses AI tools like ChatGPT for quick market benchmarks, understands the value of integrated platforms but currently relies on disparate tools.
user_personas.timestamp: 00:01:00-00:01:05 (introduction), 00:09:37-00:14:02 (demonstrates Excel proficiency), 00:19:21-00:21:33 (uses ChatGPT), 00:26:29-00:27:10 (describes time constraints and manual effort), 00:36:55-00:37:09 (desires easier system)

user_personas.name: Pedro Judice (Tech Entrepreneur/AI Specialist)
user_personas.role: Computer science graduate, works in AI for autonomous vehicles, exploring applying AI to new industries like real estate development.
user_personas.goals: Understand the current pain points and workflows in real estate to identify opportunities for AI automation, specifically in data evaluation and complex system creation.
user_personas.frustrations: The manual, cognitive processes in real estate that could be automated, the 'gap' between powerful AI tools and their practical application in industry workflows.
user_personas.tech_sophistication: Highly technical, experienced in AI model training and large-scale data evaluation, familiar with cutting-edge AI paradigms (OpenAI, Entropic, AI agents).
user_personas.timestamp: 00:02:24-00:03:53 (describes tech background), 00:04:08-00:04:20 (applying AI to new industries), 00:44:50-00:45:21 (identifies the 'bridge the gap' problem)

user_personas.name: Henrique Cordeiro Guerra (Facilitator/Real Estate Investor)
user_personas.role: Introduces Pedro to Rodolfo, interested in leveraging technology in the real estate sector.
user_personas.goals: Connect tech expertise with real estate needs, explore innovative solutions for the industry.
user_personas.frustrations: Not explicitly stated, but implied desire for more efficient real estate processes.
user_personas.tech_sophistication: Aware of tech trends, but not a hands-on technical user.

stated_requirements.description: A system that could make my life easier for evaluating deals, especially for 'back of the envelope' analysis.
stated_requirements.context: Discussing the time-consuming nature of current evaluation methods.
stated_requirements.evidence: 'But if I had a system that could make my life easier, I would do it much easier' (00:36:55-00:37:00).

stated_requirements.description: A product that mixes financial modeling with zoning information.
stated_requirements.context: Identifying a significant deficiency in current tools and a complex area that AI could address.
stated_requirements.evidence: 'But where I see a very big deficiency is what we're talking about now. If you can mix the two, if you can build a financial model together with the zoning part, that would be very interesting.' (00:43:31-00:43:48).

stated_requirements.description: An iterative proforma system where AI provides a first curve (initial data) based on market data, and then a human can evaluate and adjust.
stated_requirements.context: Describing an ideal workflow for financial modeling.
stated_requirements.evidence: 'So, if you could make a proforma, an iterative one, where you could pass the first curve, look, this is my project... the AI cuts the information, then you work on it, I think it would be a spectacular product for the development.' (00:35:38-00:36:16).

stated_requirements.description: A user interface where the user inputs project details (address, zone) and the system automatically pulls zoning information and constructs a proforma.
stated_requirements.context: Imagining an integrated platform that automates data retrieval and initial model setup.
stated_requirements.evidence: 'Imagine that instead of me going to the GPT chat and playing with the GPT chat and putting it in my system, I already had a user interface, what is the project you want to do? The address, then you put the address. What is your zone? You put the zone, you don't even need it. This address here, the zoning, is this one. You can do this here... And you go down the system by the prompt and the system constructs. This is your platform.' (00:45:30-00:45:59).

stated_requirements.description: A tool that bridges the gap between AI intelligence and practical application, avoiding manual copying and pasting between screens.
stated_requirements.context: Observing Rodolfo's current workflow of using ChatGPT and then manually transferring data.
stated_requirements.evidence: 'I think where AI is not yet being used in scale, it's kind of bridging this gap between that intelligence that's there and what you're trying to do. Making this bridge of not leaving a screen, putting it in the GPT chat, copying and returning.' (00:45:07-00:45:21).

implicit_requirements.description: Automated data extraction from unstructured documents (e.g., PDF Offering Memorandums) into structured financial models.
implicit_requirements.context: Rodolfo manually extracts data from PDFs and inputs it into Excel. This is a significant time sink.
implicit_requirements.evidence: Visual: Rodolfo scrolling through a PDF OM (14:02-16:27). Verbal: 'All this is manual input' (00:09:52).

implicit_requirements.description: Integration of market data sources (like CoStar or similar public data) directly into the financial modeling platform.
implicit_requirements.context: Rodolfo manually validates his assumptions with market data from various sources, including CoStar (directly or indirectly).
implicit_requirements.evidence: 'I can see very well a system where AI brings a database already, or some inputs where you can work behind it.' (00:12:51-00:12:55).

implicit_requirements.description: A centralized platform for real estate deal evaluation that combines different analysis types (financial, market, zoning).
implicit_requirements.context: The current workflow involves multiple disparate tools and manual data transfer.
implicit_requirements.evidence: Visual: Switching between Excel, PDF, ChatGPT. Verbal: 'If you can mix the two, if you can build a financial model together with the zoning part, that would be very interesting.' (00:43:34-00:43:48).

implicit_requirements.description: Tools to accelerate the 'back of the envelope' analysis to allow for evaluation of more deals.
implicit_requirements.context: Rodolfo currently evaluates 2-3 deals per week for quick analysis, but could do more if the process was faster.
implicit_requirements.evidence: 'But if I had a system that could make my life easier, I would do it much easier... the market can be much more' (00:36:55-00:37:15).

implicit_requirements.description: Automated generation of market benchmarks for different property types and locations.
implicit_requirements.context: Rodolfo uses ChatGPT to get quick benchmarks for unfamiliar property types.
implicit_requirements.evidence: Visual: ChatGPT providing rent, vacancy, OPEX, cap rate for Coral Gables office (19:21-21:33). Verbal: 'How do I underwrite an office building? What should I use rent per square foot per year? What should be the vacancy, the OPEX ratio, the cap rate?' (00:19:56-00:20:01).

market_context.industry: Real Estate Development (Residential, Office, Retail, Industrial, Commercial)
market_context.market_size: Focus on small to mid-sized developers who could benefit from increased deal flow speed and value. Larger developers may have in-house solutions or teams.
competitors_mentioned: Companies developing zoning analysis apps (Rodolfo mentions a past company he worked for)
market_context.regulatory_considerations: Complex and varied zoning codes across different cities and neighborhoods, which dictate what can be built on a parcel of land (e.g., setbacks, industrial vs. residential zones).
market_context.geographic_focus: United States (Miami, Coral Gables, Kissimmee/Orlando, FL), Asia (Pedro's past experience), Silicon Valley (Pedro's current location and tech ecosystem).
market_context.market_specific_details: Real estate valuation is described as an 'art' requiring significant industry knowledge. There's a distinction between 'passive' deal flow (receiving OMs) and 'active' searching (e.g., realtor.com).

key_metrics.metric: Time for 'Back of the Envelope' analysis
key_metrics.context: To get a quick sense of whether a project makes sense.
key_metrics.evidence: 'I don't want to spend more than... 3, 4 hours doing this thing' (00:26:31-00:26:35).

key_metrics.context: For a well-done, detailed financial model.

key_metrics.metric: Frequency of 'Back of the Envelope' analysis (Rodolfo)
key_metrics.context: Rodolfo's personal frequency, noting market potential for more.
key_metrics.evidence: 'back of the envelope, I do two per week' (00:36:43). 'But back of the envelope, two or three per week.' (00:37:23).

key_metrics.metric: Frequency of 'Back of the Envelope' analysis (Other companies)
key_metrics.context: Indicates higher demand/volume in the market.
key_metrics.evidence: 'but there are companies that do ten per week' (00:36:46).

key_metrics.context: From the initial 'back of the envelope' evaluations, only a few proceed to deep analysis.
key_metrics.evidence: 'of these ten per month, maybe I go deep into two' (00:37:34-00:37:37).

key_metrics.context: Highlighting the expense of a key data source.
key_metrics.evidence: 'The cold store is worth $2,000 a month, something like that.' (00:32:37).

key_metrics.value: $50 million (total valuation), $60 million (total costs), $11 million (net loss)
key_metrics.context: Result of Rodolfo's 'back of the envelope' analysis for a specific project.
key_metrics.evidence: 'I got to a total valuation of the project of 50 million, but then I put all my costs here, I'll get to 60 million, that is, I'll have a loss of 11 million.' (00:28:35-00:28:44).

key_metrics.metric: Office Rent per sq/ft per year (Coral Gables)
key_metrics.context: Benchmarks provided by ChatGPT for underwriting an office building.
key_metrics.evidence: 'Average office rent in Coral Gate was 50-55 bucks per square foot per year. Class office space 53-59. Class B office space typically lower strongly or 43.' (00:20:09-00:20:21).
'Vacancy rate, 9% to 11%. Brother Miami Market 15-16%. But as this is in Coral Gables, it's at 9-16%.' (00:20:26-00:20:33).
'Operating expenses, this is what I wanted, from 30% to 40%.' (00:20:37).

key_metrics.context: Benchmarks provided by ChatGPT and validated against OM.
key_metrics.evidence: 'According to this website, you have between 6.8% and 7.2%. In Corel Gable, the market data, you have between 6.5% and 7%. So he said, why don't you use 7%?' (00:25:47-00:25:53).

technical_constraints.constraint: Reliance on Microsoft Excel for financial modeling.
technical_constraints.description: Users are deeply entrenched in Excel for complex calculations and iterative analysis. Any new solution would need to either integrate with Excel or provide a compelling alternative with similar flexibility.
technical_constraints.evidence: Visual: Extensive use of Excel spreadsheets (09:37-14:02, 26:16-28:49). Verbal: 'you building a model in Excel' (00:05:58).

technical_constraints.constraint: Manual data transfer between disparate applications.
technical_constraints.description: The current workflow involves copying data from PDFs and ChatGPT into Excel, indicating a lack of seamless integration.
technical_constraints.evidence: Visual: Switching between PDF, ChatGPT, and Excel. Verbal: 'taking this information and put it on the other side' (00:44:43-00:44:46). 'Making this bridge of not leaving a screen, putting it in the GPT chat, copying and returning.' (00:45:15-00:45:21).

technical_constraints.constraint: Need for a robust underlying database for AI models.
technical_constraints.description: AI solutions require access to comprehensive and accurate real estate data to provide valuable insights.
technical_constraints.evidence: 'I can see very well a system where AI brings a database already' (00:12:51-00:12:55). Rodolfo also mentions CoStar as a 'giant database' (00:07:46).

technical_constraints.description: Automating zoning analysis requires parsing and interpreting highly complex, varied, and often unstructured regulatory documents.
technical_constraints.evidence: 'Each city has a different zoning code... There are 60 different types of zones. And each of these different zones has different restrictions.' (00:41:53-00:42:32).

technical_constraints.constraint: Desire for an intuitive user interface (UI).
technical_constraints.description: Users want a platform that guides them through the process, automatically pulling data based on simple inputs like an address.
technical_constraints.evidence: 'I already had a user interface, what is the project you want to do? The address, then you put the address. What is your zone? You put the zone, you don't even need it.' (00:45:32-00:45:47).

observations: The user frequently switches between Microsoft Teams (video call), Microsoft Excel (financial modeling), Adobe Acrobat (PDF viewer for Offering Memorandums), and ChatGPT (AI research tool). This visually demonstrates the lack of an integrated platform for real estate analysis.

The Excel spreadsheets shown (INVESTMENT SUMMARY, Back of the Envelope) feature numerous 'blue' cells designated for manual input, highlighting the labor-intensive nature of populating financial models.
Scrolling through the PDF Offering Memorandum and ChatGPT conversation visually confirms that data needs to be read, interpreted, and then manually transferred to the Excel model.

The 'INVESTMENT SUMMARY' Excel spreadsheet is highly detailed, with multiple tabs and sections (SOURCES AND USES, PROFORMA KEY ASSUMPTIONS, PROPERTY LEVEL RETURNS, etc.), indicating the depth of analysis required for real estate projects.

visual_evidence_summary.theme: Variety of Data Sources and Formats
observations: Data is presented in various formats: structured tables in Excel, text and tables within PDFs (Offering Memorandum), and conversational text from ChatGPT. This diversity underscores the challenge of consolidating information.

visual_evidence_summary.theme: AI as a Quick Research Tool
observations: The ChatGPT interface shows a detailed prompt and a structured response providing market benchmarks, illustrating how AI is currently used for rapid information gathering for specific queries.
